explanation:
To determine whether OS_CondVarBroadcast (including the behaviour of the functions it calls) violates the MISRA C "for loop shall be well-formed" rule, the analyzer must inspect any called functions and relevant type/constant definitions that could contain or influence for-loops. For each listed symbol:

- OS_ObjectIdGetById: Direct callee; its body may contain for-loops or modify objects used as loop counters/flags.
- OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit: Callee of OS_ObjectIdGetById; include to inspect its loops/side-effects.
- OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex: Callee of OS_ObjectIdGetById; may contain loops or index manipulation relevant to loop-counter rules.
- OS_ObjectIdConvertToken: Callee of OS_ObjectIdGetById; may contain loops or modify objects used in loops.
- OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel: Callee of OS_ObjectIdGetById; include to check for loops and side-effects.
- OS_CondVarBroadcast_Impl: Direct callee invoked when parameter check succeeds; its body is part of the effective behaviour and must be checked for for-loops and modifications of loop counters/flags.
- OS_ObjectIndexFromToken: Callee of OS_CondVarBroadcast_Impl; include to inspect any loops or shared-object modifications.

(The unit-test stub functions appear in the static call graph of OS_CondVarBroadcast; their behaviour is part of the transitive call-set and thus must be considered if present in the build:)

- UT_Stub_RegisterReturnType: Callee listed for OS_CondVarBroadcast; include to inspect any loops or side-effects introduced by test-shim code.
- UT_GetStubEntry: Callee of UT_Stub_RegisterReturnType; include to inspect for-loops in stub support.
- UT_ClearStubEntry: Callee of UT_Stub_RegisterReturnType; include to inspect for-loops.
- UtAssert_Abort: Callee of UT_Stub_RegisterReturnType and UT_Stub_RegisterContextWithMetaData; include in case assertions contain loops or modify objects used as loop counters.
- UT_Stub_RegisterContextWithMetaData: Callee listed for OS_CondVarBroadcast; include to inspect for-loops/side-effects.
- UT_ExecuteBasicHandler: Callee listed for OS_CondVarBroadcast; include because it may call handlers containing loops.
- UT_SetHandlerFunction: Callee of UT_ExecuteBasicHandler; include to inspect loops.
- UT_DefaultStubImpl: Callee of UT_ExecuteBasicHandler; include to inspect loops/side-effects.
- UT_Stub_GetReturnValuePtr: Callee listed for OS_CondVarBroadcast; include to inspect any loops or context modifications.
- UtAssert_GetContext: Callee of UT_Stub_GetReturnValuePtr; include to inspect for-loops.

(Type and constant definitions used in the target function:)
- OS_object_token_t: Type of token passed to impl; needed to see if token or its fields are used as loop counters/flags in callees.
- osal_id_t: Type of var_id parameter; included to detect uses of the id in loops or as loop counters.
- int32: Return type; include for type information if loop counters use same integer typedefs.
- OS_LOCK_MODE_NONE: Constant passed to OS_ObjectIdGetById; include in case its value affects conditional loops in callee(s).
- OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR: Constant passed to OS_ObjectIdGetById; include for same reason.
- OS_SUCCESS: Return code value tested by caller; include because control flow (whether impl is called) depends on it and thus whether impl's loops are part of effective behaviour.

Rationale summary: MISRA requires that loop formation be checked including the behaviour of called functions inside the loop body. Although OS_CondVarBroadcast has no for-loop itself, its callees (and their callees) may contain for-loops or modify objects used as loop counters or control flags. The listed symbols cover the direct and immediate transitive callees shown in the static call graph and the type/constant definitions needed to understand whether any loop counters/flags used in those functions violate the rule.
